IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: CHARITABLE GRANT MAKING TO NONPROFITS IN MARIN COUNTY, THE BAY AREA AND BEYOND.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE FOUNDATION IS TO ENCOURAGE AND APPLY PHILANTHROPIC CONTRIBUTIONS TO HELP IMPROVE THE HUMAN CONDITION, EMBRACE DIVERSITY, PROMOTE A HUMANE AND DEMOCRATIC SOCIETY, AND ENHANCE THE COMMUNITY'S QUALITY OF LIFE, NOW AND FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS.
IRS990.Desc: IN FISCAL YEAR 2022, MARIN COMMUNITY FOUNDATION (MCF) GRANTED OVER $197 MILLION FROM ITS FAMILY AND COMMUNITY FUNDS TO NONPROFITS IN MARIN COUNTY, ELSEWHERE IN THE U.S., AND AROUND THE WORLD. THESE GRANTS SUPPORTED A WIDE RANGE OF COMMUNITY NEEDS, INCLUDING SOCIAL SERVICES, EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS, THE ARTS AND ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES.

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: AMOUNTS DUE TO BENEFICIARIES OF SPLIT-INTEREST AGREEMENTS
AMOUNTS INVESTED ON BEHALF OF NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MARIN COMMUNITY FOUNDATION (MCF) HOLDS ASSETS IN DONOR-RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS IN ORDER TO CARRY OUT ITS MISSION OF ENCOURAGING AND APPLYING PHILANTHROPIC CONTRIBUTIONS.

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: CENTRAL AMERICA AND THE CARIBBEAN - ANTIGUA & BARBUDA, ARUBA, BAHAMAS,

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MARIN COMMUNITY FOUNDATION FOLLOWS THE SAME PROCEDURES FOR ALL OF ITS GRANTS AS DESCRIBED IN SCHEDULE I, PART IV. IN ADDITION, THE FOUNDATION FOLLOWS THE EXPENDITURE RESPONSIBILITY (ER) OR EQUIVALENCY DETERMINATION RULES (ED) FOR ALL OF ITS FOREIGN GRANTS. FOR BOTH ED AND ER GRANTS, THE GRANTEE SIGNS A GRANT AGREEMENT CONFIRMING THAT THE FUNDS WILL BE USED IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE PURPOSE AND IRS REGULATIONS ARTICULATED IN THE DOCUMENTS. FOR ER GRANTS, THE GRANTEES PROVIDE A NARRATIVE AND AN EXPENDITURE REPORT DETAILING THE USE OF THE FUNDS AS FORMERLY AGREED TO IN THE GRANT AGREEMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TO QUALIFY FOR A GRANT DISTRIBUTION FROM THE FOUNDATION A GRANTEE MUST BE ABLE TO SATISFY THE FOUNDATION'S DUE DILIGENCE REQUIREMENTS. THIS PROCESS INCLUDES MAKING AN INDEPENDENT INVESTIGATION OF THE PROSPECTIVE GRANTEE TO ESTABLISH THAT IT QUALIFIES TO RECEIVE THE GRANT. THE GRANTEE ORGANIZATION MUST ALSO HAVE THE CAPACITY TO FULFILL THE TERMS OF THE GRANT AND BE WILLING TO FURNISH THE FOUNDATION WITH ANY REQUIRED EVALUATIVE REPORTS. FOR GRANTS ORIGINATING FROM DONOR-ADVISED FUNDS, EACH GRANTEE IS INSTRUCTED IN WRITING THAT NO ONE ASSOCIATED WITH THE FUND MAY RECEIVE ANY PERSONAL BENEFIT BECAUSE OF THE GRANT, AND THAT THE GRANT MUST BE USED FOR CHARITABLE PURPOSES ONLY. DEPENDING UPON THE SIZE AND SOURCE OF THE GRANT, A WRITTEN REPORT FROM THE GRANTEE MAY BE REQUIRED.
MARIN COMMUNITY FOUNDATION PROVIDES A REIMBURSEMENT OF UP TO $600 EACH CALENDAR YEAR FOR QUALIFIED HEALTH AND FITNESS EXPENSES TO ALL EMPLOYEES.
THOMAS PETERS $18,984, S.A. HARTMAN $19,500, ALEXANDRA DERBY $19,500, AND LAUREN MCCLELLAND $19,500 PARTICIPATED IN A SUPPLEMENTAL NON-QUALIFIED RETIREMENT PLAN.
THIS NUMBER REPRESENTS THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS MADE NOT THE NUMBER OF ITEMS CONTRIBUTED.

MARIN COMMUNITY FOUNDATION (MFC) USES COINBASE, A COMPANY THAT OPERATES A CRYPTOCURRENCY EXCHANGE PLATFORM. ALL CRYPTOCURRENCY GIFTS ARE RECEIVED INTO MCF'S COINBASE ACCOUNT WHICH IS LIQUIDATED VIA COINBASE ON THE DAY RECEIVED.

MCF SUPPORTED THE PHILANTHROPIC INVOLVEMENT OF INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES, BUSINESSES, AND ORGANIZATIONS IN THE COMMUNITY THROUGH THE ESTABLISHMENT OF UNRESTRICTED, DONOR-ADVISED, FIELD-OF-INTEREST, DESIGNATED BENEFICIARY, AND SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS. AT THE END OF FISCAL YEAR 2022, MCF ADMINISTERED OVER 860 COMPONENT FUNDS AND 9 ACTIVE SUPPORTING ORGANIZATIONS. II. DISTRIBUTION TRUSTEE OF THE LEONARD AND BERYL BUCK TRUST ("BUCK FAMILY FUND"): DURING FISCAL YEAR 2022, NEW GRANTS AWARDED FROM THE BUCK FAMILY FUND IN SUPPORT OF MCF'S GOAL TO CREATE EQUITY OF OPPORTUNITY FOR EVERY RESIDENT OF MARIN TOTALED $32.1 MILLION. GRANTS WERE MADE TO SUPPORT THE FOUR KEY THEMES OF EDUCATION, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT THAT ARE CENTRAL TO ADDRESSING THE INEQUITIES THAT EXIST IN MARIN COUNTY TODAY. OTHER ISSUE AREAS SUPPORTED WERE IN THE AREAS OF SAFETY NET FUNDING, CAPACITY BUILDING AND CIVIC ENGAGEMENT. III. LOANS AT THE END OF FY 2022, THE COMMUNITY INVESTMENT LOAN FUND HAD 18 LOANS IN ITS PORTFOLIO AND $12.3 MILLION IN PRINCIPAL OUTSTANDING. THE FOUNDATION MAKES BELOW-MARKET RATE LOANS TO NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO MEET A NUMBER OF OBJECTIVES: TO PROVIDE INVESTMENT CAPITAL PROJECTS AND REVENUE-PRODUCING VENTURES; TO ENCOURAGE THE ECONOMIC INDEPENDENCE AND STABILITY OF NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS; TO PROVIDE ALTERNATIVES TO OR AUGMENT TRADITIONAL FUNDING SOURCES; TO MEET EMERGENCY CASH FLOW NEEDS AND OTHER SITUATIONS; AND TO FINANCE EQUIPMENT PURCHASES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE CHIEF FINANCIAL & OPERATING OFFICER AND VICE PRESIDENT OF FINANCE FOR REVIEW BEFORE FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BOARD, OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES MUST REVIEW THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND COMPLETE A QUESTIONNAIRE CONCERNING COMPLIANCE ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. THE FORMS ARE REVIEWED BY THE CORPORATE SECRETARY AND CFO TO ENSURE ONGOING COMPLIANCE AND DETERMINE WHETHER A CONFLICT EXISTS. ALL CONFLICTS AND POTENTIAL CONFLICTS ARE REQUIRED TO BE DISCLOSED, AND THE PERSON IS EXCLUDED FROM PARTICIPATING IN DELIBERATIONS AND DECISIONS CONCERNING THE MATTER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PRESIDENT AND CEO IS THE TOP MANAGEMENT OFFICIAL OF THE ORGANIZATION AND THEIR COMPENSATION PACKAGE IS REVIEWED AND DECIDED UPON ANNUALLY BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. A COMPENSATION COMMITTEE COMPRISED OF SEVERAL INDEPENDENT MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS ESTABLISHED ANNUALLY. AS PART OF THIS PROCESS, THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE PREPARES A WRITTEN PERFORMANCE APPRAISAL WITH INPUT FROM ALL BOARD MEMBERS. FURTHER, THE COMMITTEE COMPARES THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION TO THAT OF OTHERS IN SIMILAR POSITIONS USING VARIOUS SURVEYS. EVERY FEW YEARS, THE COMMITTEE ENGAGES AN INDEPENDENT EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION CONSULTANT TO EVALUATE THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION PACKAGE TO DETERMINE IF THE COMPONENTS, AS WELL AS, THE PACKAGE AS A WHOLE CONTINUE TO BE FAIR AND REASONABLE. DURING EXECUTIVE SESSION AT THE END OF THE FISCAL YEAR, WITH ALL BOARD MEMBERS ATTENDING, THE COMMITTEE REPORTS THEIR FINDINGS, THE OVERALL APPRAISAL, AND THEIR RECOMMENDATION. AFTER REVIEW AND DISCUSSION, THE BOARD DETERMINES THE PRESIDENT AND CEO'S COMPENSATION FOR THE NEXT YEAR. A SIMILAR PROCESS IS USED TO REVIEW THE CHIEF FINANCIAL & OPERATING OFFICERS' COMPENSATION. SALARY ADJUSTMENTS FOR ALL OTHER STAFF, INCLUDING OTHER OFFICERS, ARE APPROVED BY THE PRESIDENT AND CEO WITHIN THE BUDGETARY GUIDELINES APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. EVERY FEW YEARS AN OUTSIDE CONSULTANT IS ENGAGED TO REVIEW INDUSTRY AND REGIONAL SURVEYS TO ENSURE ALL STAFF MEMBERS' COMPENSATION LEVELS ARE FAIR AND REASONABLE. THE LAST SUCH REVIEW WAS COMPLETED IN JUNE 2021.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
THE ORGANIZATION HAS AN AUDIT COMMITTEE TO ASSUME RESPONSIBILITY OF THE AUDIT, AND OVERSEE THE WHOLE AUDIT.
